titles.title: Judicial Taxation Prohibition Act of 1993
To amend title 28, United States Code, to clarify the remedial jurisdiction relating to taxes of inferior Federal courts.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Judiciary.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Intellectual Property and Judicial Administration.

bill.summary: 1/5/1993--Introduced. Judicial Taxation Prohibition Act of 1993 - Amends the Federal judicial code to deny to inferior Federal courts jurisdiction to issue any remedy, order, writ, or other judicial decree requiring the Federal Government or any State or local government to impose any new tax or to increase any existing tax or tax rate.
